However, the owner of the restaurant, chef Kelly Kim, who is Korean-American, says sheâ€™s operated numerous Yellow Fever restaurants and never faced any opposition to the name before now.

Whole Foods did not immediately return Fortuneâ€™s request for comment about Yellow Fever.
Kim added that she was re-appropriating the term and that the issue actually came up while working out the details of partnering with Whole Foods . The supermarket chain had Kim change some of the ingredients in her dishes, the Daily News reported.
â€œI hope that once they come in and try our food and see us for who we are and who weâ€™re trying to be, that theyâ€™ll realize that theyâ€™re picking on the little kid, you know?â€ Kim told CBS. SPONSORED FINANCIAL CONTENT
